borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed development&nbsp;has potential to increase activity level and coming and goings to and from the site leading to additional levels of noise and disturbance at the property. This is considered to have a negative impact on neighbouring amenity and in turn the health and wellbeing of neighbouring residents. As such the proposal is contrary to:-</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policy D14 of the&nbsp;London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies DMD 1 and DMSI 3 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (2021)</span></p>

<span style="font-size:11pt">1.&nbsp;The proposed development, by reason of the&nbsp;change of use to a HMO, would result in the loss&nbsp;of&nbsp;a 3-bedroom (plus) family-sized dwelling which is a priority house type within the Borough. The proposal would not provide an in demand housing type for residents of the borough.</span><span style="font-size:11pt"></span>&nbsp;<span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="" style="color:#333333">Therefore the negatives arising from the provision of a house of multiple occupancy are&nbsp;</span>considered to outweigh any significant benefits,&nbsp;having regard to the presumption in favour of sustainable development. As such, the proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to;</span><br><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify;"><br></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify;"><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies&nbsp;H9 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies CM1 and CC1 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policy BC4 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policies SPDG 1, SP 3 and DMH 5&nbsp;of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="color:#c0392b">The proposed development, by reason of its undersized kitchen, dining and living areas, coupled with the inappropriate layout, represents a substandard quality of accommodation to the detriment of future occupiers. Refusal is warranted on this basis. The proposal is therefore contrary to;&nbsp;</span></span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BP11 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:11pt">Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy DMD1 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">East London HMO Guidance (4)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt"><br></span><span style="font-size:11pt"><br></span><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="color:#c0392b"><br></span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">By reason of failing to provide</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;evidence to demonstrate that the road can handle the additional no. of vehicles resulting from the development, and in the absense of an agreement to restrict the development to be 'car free' (via S106), the proposal would represent undue harm to local highways, resulting in potentially 8 (or more) vehicles being parked within the street.&nbsp; The proposal is therefore contrary to;</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy T6.1 of the London Plan (2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BR9 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:11pt">Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy DMT 3 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size:11pt"> London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span><span style="font-size:11pt"><br></span><span style="font-size:11pt"><br></span><br></p>
description: Change of use from single use dwelling to a 8 bedroom House in Multiple Occupation (sui generis), including the construction of a two storey side and rear extension and loft conversion with a rear dormer extension.

constraints_details.result: 41 Eustace Road, Chadwell Heath, Romford, Barking And Dagenham, RM6 6JL
